Class DotStar

java.lang.Object
DotStar
public class DotStar extends Object
This class is used for controlling a Dotstar LED strip on a Rapberry Pi.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    DotStar​(int num_leds)
    Constructs a Dotstar object with a blue-green-red order.
    DotStar​(int num_leds, String order)
    Constructs a Dotstar object with a specified order.

  • Constructor Details

    • DotStar

      public DotStar​(int num_leds, String order) throws IOException
      Constructs a Dotstar object with a specified order.
      Parameters:
      num_leds - The number of LEDs in the strand.
      order - String representation of the order of pixels. (e.g. "RGB")
      Throws:
      IOException - Thrown if the SPI connection fails to initialize or the write to clear the LEDs fails.

    • DotStar

      public DotStar​(int num_leds) throws IOException
      Constructs a Dotstar object with a blue-green-red order.
      Parameters:
      num_leds - The number of LEDs in the strand.
      Throws:
      IOException - Thrown if the SPI connection fails to initialize or the write to clear the LEDs fails.

  • Method Details

    • begin

      public void begin() throws IOException
      Starts the SPI connection.
      Throws:
      IOException - Thrown if the SPI connection fails to initialize.

    • setColorOrder

      public void setColorOrder​(String order)
      Sets the indeces of each byte in the 3 byte pixel.
      Parameters:
      order - String representation of the order of pixels. (e.g. "RGB")

    • updateLength

      public void updateLength​(int num_leds)
      Change the length of the DotStar strip.
      Parameters:
      num_leds - The number of LEDs in the strip.

    • clear

      public void clear()
      Sets all pixels to OFF.

    • fill

      public void fill​(int r, int g, int b)
      Sets all pixels to the specified RGB value. Does not immediately affect what's currently displayed on the LEDs. The next call to show() will refresh the LEDs to display this change.
      Parameters:
      r - Red, 0=minimum (off), 255=brightest.
      g - Green, 0=minimum (off), 255=brightest.
      b - Blue, 0=minimum (off), 255=brightest.

    • setPixelColor

      public void setPixelColor​(int index, int r, int g, int b)
      Sets specified pixel to specified RGB value. Does not immediately affect what's currently displayed on the LEDs. The next call to show() will refresh the LEDs to display this pixel.
      Parameters:
      index - Index of the pixel.
      r - Red, 0=minimum (off), 255=brightest.
      g - Green, 0=minimum (off), 255=brightest.
      b - Blue, 0=minimum (off), 255=brightest.

    • setBrightness

      public void setBrightness​(int b)
      Adjust output brightness. Does not immediately affect what's currently displayed on the LEDs. The next call to show() will refresh the LEDs at this level.
      Parameters:
      b - Brightness setting, 0=minimum (off), 255=brightest.

    • show

      public void show() throws IOException
      Sends the stored pixel values to the strip.
      Throws:
      IOException - Thrown if the write to the strip fails.
